person_analysis.overview: Mike Kirkup is a Waterloo-based founder, product leader, and startup coach with nearly two decades of experience bridging technical leadership and business strategy. He is currently Co-Founder of Elderella, an AI-powered elder care administrator tackling the looming demographic shift in Canada and the US. Previously, he founded Arlo (AI loan processing) and served as CTO of EnPowered, while also mentoring dozens of startups through Communitech. Known for candid reflections on founder journeys and expertise in AI-native development, Mike is a driving force in scaling impactful products and mentoring the next generation of Waterloo entrepreneurs.
person_analysis.executive_summary: Mike Kirkup is a Canadian founder and product leader specializing in AI-native product development and startup scaling. As Co-Founder of Elderella and former CTO of EnPowered, he combines technical expertise with strategic leadership to build impactful platforms. A University of Waterloo graduate with both Computer Science and Management Science degrees, Mike is also a Growth Coach at Communitech, where he helps founders navigate product-market fit, fundraising, and scaling challenges. His career reflects a blend of hands-on technical leadership, founder resilience, and ecosystem impact.
